page.title: 15GIRDLENESS LIGHTHOUSE
page.content: Girdleness lighthouse stands on the promonotory to the south of Aberdeen Harbour.It was built for the "Commissioners of the Northern Lights" and is one of the few Victorian buildings in Aberdeen constructed on behalf of non-Aberdonians. The lighthouse was designed by Robert Stevenson,grandfather of the writer Robert Louis Stevenson. Built to a height of 131 feet it affords a magnificent view of the city and surrounding coastline for those fit enough to climb the 189 steps. The light was first operated in October 1833 and in 1890 the present revolving light was installed.This flashes twice every 20 seconds and can be seen out to sea 19 miles away in good conditions. However Aberdeen, like many towns on the eastern seaboard of Scotland
